boardgame.description: In Ghosts!, each player has four good ghosts and four evil ghosts _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; but only the player who owns a ghost can see whether it's good or evil (as with the pieces in Stratego). These ghosts start the game in the back rows of a 6x6 game board with the corners removed. Each turn, a player moves one of his ghosts one square orthogonally. Moving into an opponent's ghost kills that ghost. To win, you must get rid of your own evil ghosts, kill your opponent's good ghosts, or move one of your good ghosts off the board from one of your opponent's corner squares._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 1986 Årets Spel Best Family Game Winner

listing.notes: Box scuffed, rules somewhat worn, pieces and board in nice shape. Has 1 extra ghost.

Noris edition of the game. Complete and in very nice shape... Shipping at actual cost dependend on destination, total weight and method of shipment chosen. Usually shipping a single (regular sized) boardgame (surface) costs 12.30€ worldwide and 8.20€ within Europe. Smaller games ship cheaper. Of course multiple games can be combined.
Opened and played once.

********************************************** Ghosts! A very creepy, sneaky guess-who game Ages 6-14 For 2 Players Milton Bradley ********************************************** This is kind of like a very simple and quick version of Stratego. It takes only five minutes to play. Each player is given eight ghost pieces, four of which are _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;good_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; and four of which are _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;evil_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. Each turn, move a ghost one space. Capture an opponent_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s ghost by moving onto it. Win by either (1) getting one of your good ghosts out the door at the other side of the board; (2) capturing all of your opponent_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;good_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; ghosts; or (3) tricking your opponent into capturing all of your _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;evil_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; ghosts. This game was invented by the late Alex Randolph. ********************************************** From the box: They_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;re All White All The Same Height And All With Pleats In Their Sheets... CAN YOU TELL THEM APART? Sixteen sneaky ghosts are ready to play a game of escape-and-capture with you. If half are nasty, and half are nice, and all of them look exactly alike, can you capture the good-spirited among them? Hidden colored dots identify the ghosts as good or bad. But neither you nor your opponent sees each other_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s dots, so it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s guess-who on every move! Bluff often and guess well to win Ghosts!...the sneakiest, creepiest fake-out game ever! ...AND THEY GLOW, TOO! The pawns shine in the dark for an extra special ghostly glow. ********************************************** Condition: Box is in pretty good shape; some wear at the corners, slight paper damage on the box bottom. No split corners. ********************************************** Contents, complete and in good condition: 1 dungeon gameboard 16 ghost pawns Rules Cardboard insert, in great shape ********************************************** Buyer pays shipping. I always charge actual shipping costs; there is never a handling cost. I prefer USPS, but will use any service you request. Please e-mail me if you need shipping costs sooner.

Geister from Schmidt Spiele Box: has light shelf-wear and a few dings and wrinkles.
